sentences.en: {"GLOSS":["the rights of kings and queens"],"COLLOINEXA":["the royal prerogative"]}
A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.
sentences.cn: 懦夫不能表露爱意, 那是勇者的专利.

sentences.en: A monarch has the prerogative of pardoning criminals.
sentences.cn: 君主享有对罪犯的赦免权.

sentences.en: Arriving late is a woman’s prerogative .
Beyond the power of diffusing old wealth , it has the prerogative of creating new.
sentences.cn: 它除了具有分配原有的财富的能力之外, 还具有创造新财富的特殊能力.

sentences.en: Constitutional changes are exclusively the prerogative of the parliament.
sentences.cn: 修改宪法是议会独有的权力。

sentences.en: Interpretation of the Guideline is the exclusive prerogative of Germanischer Lloyd WindEnergie GmbH.
sentences.cn: 本指南的解释权归德国劳埃德船级社风能股份有限公司.

sentences.en: It is the Prime Minister's prerogative to decide when to call an election.
sentences.cn: 决定大选的日期是首相的职权.

sentences.en: It is within his prerogative to do so.
It is within his prerogative to leave.
Self - make men are very apt to usurp the prerogative of the almighty and overwork themselves.
sentences.cn: 全凭一己奋斗而成功的人,大有篡夺上帝的大权之势而过度工作.

sentences.en: Today even cash - strapped innovators can reach markets that were once the prerogative of giant organisations.
sentences.cn: 现在甚至是资金缺乏的创新者也能进入那些曾经是大型机构所独享的市场.

sentences.en: Yongjiang is not a prerogative for luxurious houses at Sanjiangkou only.
sentences.cn: 一线甬江,并非三江口豪宅的专利.

trans.tran_cn: 特权，君权，天赋的特权（能力等），特性，特点，显著的优点，[史]优先投票权，<美史>总督委任组成的法庭
trans.tran_en: a right that someone has, especially because of their importance or social position
